So you want to take a file that's in the attachments section of a particular contact and attach it to a different contact?
So you need to use a developer key
Hey but for private apps, I don’t see an option to use a developer key

Here's how to find your Developer API key:
• Confirm you are in your dev account (you'll see the banner)
• Click the Apps tab (you won't click into a specific app)
• Click the get HubSpot API key button (upper right-hand side)
I don't think you can create a calling extension through a private app
it's just public apps (they don't need to be listed on the marketplace)
then private apps loose ability to upload calls via the new recordings api?

I am trying to move to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#create-an-endpoint-to-provide-an-authenticated-recording-url-for-a-call|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#create-an-endpoint-to-provide-[…]cated-recording-url-for-a-call>
That api is meant to be used in conjuction with the calling sdk: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk>
currently private apps can't use those apis, they are meant to be used with public apps and calling extensions
what type of options are you looking for?
so private app users can’t move to the new recording api yet ?
BTW thanks for all the response so far. It is helpful.

well just a couple of things, this isn't a new api. It's been around for a little bit, it's been built to help people that want to build calling extensions on HubSpot. These calling extensions run on public apps, so currently all the infrastructure works with public apps. Maybe in the future it will work with private apps but that's really not the way it's been setup

yes they are deprecating `hs_call_recording_url` and want us to migrate to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#create-an-endpoint-to-provide-an-authenticated-recording-url-for-a-call|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#create-an-endpoint-to-provide-[…]cated-recording-url-for-a-call> However with our discussion I deduce it’s not possible for private apps to do it anymore.

i mean the schemas
That 60 day window was from the app install date
so if someone installed the app today, the app would have 60 days to create the object
not 60 days from the app creation
are you sure?
again this is something that was built at least a year ago but that's how I remember the wording

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Custom-Object-Creation-Using-OAuth-API/m-p/896875/highlight/true#M69893|does this help>?

What is going on w/ the inconsistencies w/ the Pipelines API and the mixed values for pipeline and stage IDs? They are all over the place, Some are UUIDs, some are integers, and some are just arbitrary text values. It's incredibly frustrating to work with in its current state.
Private app tokens do not expire so you don't need a refresh token.  The tokens can be rotated to create a new access token any time you want.
The documentation isn't wrong - it has this clearly listed:

It’s to keep us all on our toes apparently!

All joking aside..

Yes it’s frustrating
Now it does
after I pinged Hannah to mention it to the Docs team, lol

Hi everyone - hopefully a simple question, but I'm having difficulty returning a Deal with specific properties via the api ... can someone please tell me how else I should specify the properties I want returned? My code is below -- but "state___region" and "zipcode" are not being returned, only the default properties :(

`def get_deal(deal_id, token=TOKEN):`
  `uri = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/{dealId}>".format(dealId=deal_id)`
  `deal = requests.get(`
      `uri,`
      `headers = {`
          `"Content-Type": "application/json",`
          `'Authorization': f"Bearer {token}",`
      `},`
      `data = json.dumps({`
          `"properties": ["state___region", "zipcode"]`
      `})`
  `)`
Does it work if you put all the properties in a single string like "properties": ["state___region, zipcode"]

Hey, thanks for the answers! The context is: we are actually the tool that connects to your CRM and sync the data you have there back to our own databases. Once a customer deletes records in their HubSpot account that we had previously stored, we need a way to retrieve which records they were to delete them from our side too.

I’ve tried the Export API but it gives me a “There was a problem with the publicCrmSearchRequest” error message when I try filtering by “archived: true” which leads me to assume archived records don’t show up in the Export API (just like it is in Search API). Let me know if I’m doing something wrong though, would love to get this sorted as soon as possible
<@U25PYL3Q8> I was also thinking maybe we can use webhooks to get the deleted items but I would much prefer to use the API itself since our main infrastructure is built upon that
help me, rs.

My header:
Authorization:
Bearer pat-na1-....

I think you can change your archival process and this will work.

If you create a property for your object, somethign like “delete record” checkbox. Once that is checked, then you can do what you need to do in your database, after the database is updated, then you can archive the record via the api
This should solve the issue here
You have to proxy the requests through a serverless function
Or use crm_objects function in HubL
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/crm-objects>

I never thought about this, if the property permissions in the HubSpot UI affect API access. I thought they would not.

Do you have these "Write" scopes ticked on in the private app? You probably just need the ones for the object you are trying to update.
Hi Goran! Appreciate your help. I do have the write scopes for contacts and deals, which are the only types of objects I’m trying to update properties for. Is there anything else I should look at?

Nope that should do it. Unless there is some scope you are missing it should work and the thing you mentioned "Restrict view and edit access for properties" should not affect you. The article you shared says exactly that.
I'd reach out to support and explain your issue, they might know what's up :slightly_smiling_face:
